result.execSummary:
The defendant Jamonte L Randolph was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin (<=3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)1.
  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>1-5g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1r.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: AS TO EACH COUNT: Pay a fine of $500 plus mandatory costs, assessments  and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection. Pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution. DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

superMiscConds.notes: COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

No violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.
Do not use or possess illegally controlled substances.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with 2 days credit, concurrent to Count 1.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter from State Public Defender indicating that a lawyer cannot be appointed because defendant did not establish financial eligibility.
COPY OF NOTICE OF INTENT, court record sheet and judgment of conviction forwarded to the State Public Defender's Office in Madison.pk
records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt: NOTICE OF INTENT TO PURSUE POST-CONVICTION RELIEF RECEIVED AND FILED ON 10-13-15.pk
records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt:
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  1) no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution; 3) do not use or possess illegally controlled substances; 4) seek and maintain employment. 

COURT ORDERS:
- DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds;
- defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Sentencing proceeds.  Corrections made to the PSI report.   Statements by counsel, Josette L, Mary L. and defendant.  

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

Count 1:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  5 years with 2 days credit; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 2 years; EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 3 years; pay a fine of $500 plus mandatory costs, assessments  and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

Count 2:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 5 years with 2 days credit; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 2 years; EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 3 years - concurrent with Count 1; pay a fine of $500 plus mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.

Defendant Jamonte L Randolph in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Case heard for Br. 17.  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court finds the defendant has right to substitution prior to the finding of guilty only.  Court denies substitution request.
Case spun to Branch 44 for Sentencing as Branch 17 is in jury trial.
Sentencing Letters on behalf of defandant received and filed. tk

Defendant Jamonte L Randolph appears telephonically.  Attorney Allison Marie Ritter in court.  
Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

*CASE HEARD WITHOUT CIRCUIT COURT FILE*

Matter before the Court for rescheduling of Sentencing hearing.  The Department of Corrections is requesting sentencing date beyond 8-28-15 for reasons set forth on the record.  8-28-15 date vacated by the court; adjourned date selected with the parties.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
State's Witness List, State's Motion In Limine, State's Requested Jury Instructions received and filed. tk

Defendant Jamonte L Randolph in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
AS TO COUNT  1 and 2 - 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
Court ordered a presentence investigation WITHOUT a recommendation.  Order for presentence investigation signed and filed. Court vacated jury trial on 08-05-2015. Case adjourned for sentencing to Branch 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Filed:
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant Jamonte L Randolph in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Brandwon Wigley for Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Plea and Sentencing.   Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial and Jury Trial. Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order, signed and filed.  Copies given to state and defense counsel.  Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference on 7-1-2015 at 1:30 p.m. and Jury Trial on 8-5-2015 at 9:00 a.m., Br. 17.
State to provide Defense with any expert report no later than 5-22-2015 by 5:00 p.m. and Defense to file any challenge to the expert report no later than 6-12-2015 by 5:00 p.m.  Calendar call scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 05:00 pm.  Calendar call scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 05:00 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court reviewed the Notice of Motion and Motion to Adjourn. Case is rescheduled from 4-27-2015 at 8:30 a.m. to 5-6-2015 at 8:30 a.m. for Plea/Sentencing Hearing, Br. 17.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Adjourn filed by Attorney Allison Ritter, received and filed.

Defendant Jamonte L Randolph in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
  Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Scheduling conference held off the record. This matter may have reached a resolution and defense counsel requesting a projected plea and sentencing date. Any motions to be filed by 04-27-2015.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jamonte L Randolph in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Marissa Santiago for Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Jamonte L Randolph in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  
Defendant Jamonte L Randolph in custody.  
Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT HAS OBTAINED PRIVATE COUNSEL.  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
